summary: The Due Process Continuity of Care Act (S. 1720) amends Title XIX of the Social Security Act (Medicaid) to remove the exclusion of Medicaid coverage for inmates in custody pending disposition of charges. It also mandates planning grants for states to develop Medicaid programs for this population, including assessments of healthcare needs, provider recruitment, and quality of care initiatives. The bill defines key terms and authorizes $50 million for planning grants.
